intro: Legousia scabra var. grandiflora, commonly known as the rough legousia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue to violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
